alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Moses Lake Area; Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 4:04PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: Wintry precipitation will occur across the Inland Northwest Friday and through the Christmas holiday weekend. For Friday and Friday night, widespread light snow will fall across central and northeast Washington into far north Idaho with lowland accumulations generally between 1 and 3 inches. For Saturday and Sunday, light snow on Saturday will transition to to light freezing rain in the Columbia Basin into Chelan county. Light to moderate ice accumulations will be possible in places like Moses Lake, Wenatchee, Chelan, and Leavenworth Saturday into Sunday. Next week, warmer temperatures and rising snow levels will arrive Monday and Tuesday with accumulating snow occurring mainly over the mountains and a mix of rain and snow in the lowlands.
